metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41689 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
DCMTK through 3.6.6 does not handle string copy properly. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program, it would query its database and copy the result even if the result is null, which can incur a head-based overflow. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
libdcmtk16 - 3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
